docs.lead_paragraph: Economists say the claims and counterclaims on job creation or job destruction are often misleading.

headline.seo: New Laws Evaluated by Job-Creation Potential
headline.main: New Laws Now Evaluated by Job Creation
headline.print_headline: New Laws Now Evaluated by Job Creation

docs.abstract: Washington is applying a new yardstick when judging the merits of federal laws; instead of looking at their costs or savings, question is whether they will create or destroy jobs; economists see misleading claims and counterclaims.
docs.snippet: Economists say the claims and counterclaims on job creation or job destruction are often misleading.

docs.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set to present a strategy for $450 billion in cuts over the next 10 years — and an outline of a carefully shrunk military.

headline.seo: Pentagon to Present Vision of Reduced Military
headline.main: Panetta to Offer Strategy for Cutting Military Budget
headline.print_headline: Panetta to Offer Budget Strategy Cutting Military

docs.abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set this week to reveal a strategy that will guide the Pentagon in cutting hundreds of billions of dollars from its budget; Panetta is expected to outline plans for carefully shrinking the military, and in so doing make it clear that the Pentagon will no longer maintain the ability to fight two sustained ground wars at once.
docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is set to present a strategy for $450 billion in cuts over the next 10 years — and an outline of a carefully shrunk military.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and THOM SHANKER

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in city hospitals for months or years because there is nowhere to send them.

headline.seo: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger in Hospitals, at a High Cost
headline.main: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger in Hospitals, at a High Cost
headline.print_headline: Nowhere to Go, Patients Linger In Hospitals, At a High Cost

docs.abstract: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in New York City hospitals for months or years because they lack sufficient insurance and there is nowhere to send them; hospitals are absorbing millions of dollars in unreimbursed expenses annually while patients are deprived of services that could be provided elsewhere at a small fraction of the cost.
docs.snippet: Hundreds of patients, including illegal immigrants, who are well enough to be discharged have languished in city hospitals for months or years because there is nowhere to send them.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Confessions of a Surgeon,” by Dr. Paul A. Ruggieri, and “The Patient’s Checklist,” by Elizabeth Bailey, are guidebooks to clarify customs and keep you out of trouble when you receive care in a hospital.

headline.seo: Two Choices for the Best Read for a Hospital Stay
headline.main: Two Choices for Best Bedside Read in the Hospital
headline.print_headline: Two Choices for Best Bedside Read in the Hospital

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews books Confessions of a Surgeon: The Good, the Bad and the Complicated...Life Behind the OR Doors by Paul A Ruggieri and The Patient's Checklist: 10 Simple Hospital Checklists to Keep You Safe, Sane and Organized by Elizabeth Bailey.
docs.snippet: “Confessions of a Surgeon,” by Dr. Paul A. Ruggieri, and “The Patient’s Checklist,” by Elizabeth Bailey, are guidebooks to clarify customs and keep you out of trouble when you receive care in a hospital.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eric Lander laid the groundwork for a joint venture between two fierce rivals: Harvard and M.I.T.

headline.seo: Broad Institute Collaboration Began With a Disastrous Lunch
headline.main: A Collaboration That Began With a Disastrous Lunch
headline.print_headline: A Collaboration That Began With a Disastrous Lunch

docs.abstract: Profile of Dr Eric Lander, founder of the Broad Institute at Harvard and MIT, which was largely financed by billionaire philanthropist Eli Broad; Lander had envisioned research institution that would combine MIT's excellence in research, science and technology with Harvard's medical prowess.
docs.snippet: Eric Lander laid the groundwork for a joint venture between two fierce rivals: Harvard and M.I.T.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you want to know what is wrong with American health care today, exhibit A might be the two new proton beam treatment facilities the Mayo Clinic has begun building, one in Minnesota, the other in Arizona, at a cost of more than $180 million dollars each. They are part of a medical arms race for proton beam machines, which could cost taxpayers billions of dollars for a treatment that, in many cases, appears to be no better than cheaper alternatives.

headline.main: It Costs More, but Is It Worth More?

docs.abstract: Before paying extra for an expensive cancer treatment, Medicare should demand evidence that it's more effective.
docs.snippet: Before paying extra for an expensive cancer treatment, Medicare should demand evidence that it's more effective.

docs.lead_paragraph: Flexibility on state requirements may lessen opposition, but a national standard where all Americans enjoy the same benefits is still best.
docs.abstract: Editorial asserts that the Obama administration's decision to allow states to define 'essential health benefits' that must be provided to their citizens under the health care reform law may lessen opposition to the law's implementation; argues that federal health officials should find a way to move toward a system in which all Americans enjoy the same benefits with only limited state-by-state adjustment.
docs.snippet: Flexibility on state requirements may lessen opposition, but a national standard where all Americans enjoy the same benefits is still best.
